title: How to counter this Champion...
body:
Guess who:
Has 4.5k health by late game, does at least 240 AD with full build and usually has around 2.00 attack speed and has the hardest skillshot in the game.
Has stuns every 5 or so seconds, one of the fastest champions in the game and has one of the stronger shields in the game.
Can out push 3 people and single handedly win the game for some noobs.
Hint: **it's Udyr**
Riot's fix: **buff the Cinderhulk enchant.**

Ok, how exactly do you counter Udyr? 
CC? stun him 3 times and he'll still catch up
Armour? that's only stopping him from killing you and preventing you from building more AD to kill him and his team.
Damage? he has 4.5k hp and a shield every few seconds, get in his range to attack him and he'll stun you and eventually finish you off

**Yes, I am in bronze. Yes, I know I am terrible.**
That's why I'm asking... 

(inb4 someone tries to make up some bs on how he's only strong because I'm in Bronze, it's not like he gets a nerf once you reach higher elo)

replies.body: vayne, tank shredder with crazy self kite
I don't play ADC so I'll just ask our ADC to pick Vayne when we get matched against a Udyr. Thanks for the answer.

Please don't tell me to play another tanky champion, I find them really boring. As Sejuani, press R and you win a team fight (in Bronze at least). I'd rather play a shitty late game champ (Lee Sin) that actually takes skill/is fun to play and be in 'elo hell' forever.

LOL then stay in "elo hell". The way to counter Udyr is to win the game early before he has a chance to tank up.

Im assuming your a jungler.

the way to beat an Udyr is to beat his team. Gank every lane and either force him to stop farming and help his laners or make his laners rage quit as you camp them.

Sounds like a good plan but hard to pull off since a Lee Sin from what I've seen can't carry a whole team by himself and ADCs in Bronze aren't really that good at carrying. I guess I'll camp the best and worst lanes to get the best guy on our team fed and prevent the worst from feeding.

The entire point of playing Lee Sin is to gank early and snowball your lanes.

If you're not doing that, play a different jungle!

its talk like this....

you shouldnt complain if you arent willing to play meta picks. lee sin is bad atm because all tank junglers are better.

with BC change lee got even worse too.

I'd suggest play early game champs and don't let the game get too late but my way of countering him is with Malzahar. If you land your entire combo on him you should be able to kill him. But if I'm being honest if you're playing against a good udyr and their team is some what competent you aren't going to win, his mobility makes him get objectives so easily

Yeah he's a pest late game. Since I'm a jungler and I don't play Malzahar, as Barry said, I should just try to end the game as early as possible. It would be hard to pull of though since whenever I have a good Lee Sin game (which happens once every 10 games) my whole team feeds.

I'll definitely consider getting Malzahar so I have him whenever I'm forced out of the jungle or someone takes support. Are there any other Champs that counter Udyr?
You can't expect to win every kind of team composition with just Lee Sin, I'd like to point that out.

Yeah I exaggerated a bit with that 4.5k hp part but I was a little salty after losing a game to a split push Udyr but most Udyrs usually have 200+ ad and 2.00 attack speed while still being fairly tanky

Against an udyr?

You have a 30 minute timer to win the game, or be drastically ahead, or you lose.

Simple.

Also while we are on this, Udyr isn't a good jungler for one main reason: anyone below Platish will not gank as udyr.

Meaning you have free rein to win the game as a laner or as a jungler, just win lanes and udyr loses.
Udyr is a mid game king, but starts to fall off at 30 minutes...
But he's annoying when he split pushes. Can out push 2-3 people with his permanent warwick ult

I disagree. I think Udyr is a great jungler with his good clear speeds, mobility and sustain. Only down side is he has to run (something he's great at) to the enemy to deal damage unlike Lee Sin with his Q.

 It's also harder for an early game champ to snowball and win game early in my opinion compared to being a late game champ trying to win a 40+ minute game. I think Riot has to do something about this to make early game champs not be completely useless in the mid to late game. What do you think?
You could at least make his stats somewhat believable.
That's the meta right now. Unkillable junglers dealing tons of damage/CC.

For a second, I thought you were talking about Riven. She's equally a 'pest' in late game in that instead of being godly at splitpushing (which Riven is semi-decent at) she's far more annoying in teamfights where she can stun 2 or 3 of your team mates and face roll the keyboard in and out of teamfights.

Pick any good kiters, like Vayne and great lockdown ability'ed champion like Warwick (maybe), Nautilus (can CC train by himself), slowing items and abilities; knockups don't get reduced by tenacity as well, so make sure you pick knock up champions.

P.S. Vel'Koz's E is an 'airborne' ability and can be reduced by tenacity.
P.P.S. Vel'Koz is shit anyway. Don't play him in SoloQ.

{{champion:161}}  mid **is** bad. 
Everyone can **easily** dodge his E. It's technically not even a knock up, its CC can be nullified by Tenacity.
His main damage in lane phase, which is the second damage from W, is easily dodgeable.
He needs to hit his Q to have any decent chance of landing his other non-ultimate abiltiies.
Anyone with a decent dash/blink or movement speed boost can easily nullify the output of his Ultimate. 
Mobile Assassins which is the top tier meta in mid right now have the abilities to either dodge his Q, W, E or nullify the damage of his ult.

He'd be decent if his Ability Missile Speeds were faster or to decrease the time it takes for the second W to happen. He does decent damage if you have team mates to peel for you.
